metadata.Title: CVE-2020-21890 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in clj_media_size function in devices/gdevclj.c in Artifex Ghostscript 9.50 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact(s) via opening of crafted PDF document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21890` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
ghostscript-x - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
libgs9 - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
libgs9-common - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4').
